pros: It was a lot of fun working together as a team.
cons: Large office sometimes felt a bit cold and hard to connect with far away team members.

review_title: Perhaps has changed with new ownerships
pros: Some of the people were great
cons: Not very mission-driven, low engagement and happiness among staff
Low salary, and seems not a lot of opportunity for growth

pros: Impactful work within the conservation field; good work life balance

review_title: marine educator is for passionate people
pros: Great teamwork. You have to learn a lot of things on varied topics (which is very positive in my mind). You can participate i a lot of events and diversify if you need more hours.
cons: Be sure to have minimum work hours per week guaranteed in your contract. I was on a special program where the expenses we could have allowance expenses somehow higher than our pay, which feels weird (different budget lines allow it).

job_title: Guest Services Representative GSR in Vancouver, BC
pros: Amazing team and managers. Very friendly and professional environment.
cons: They offer low wages for entry level positions.

job_title: IT Systems Administrator in Vancouver, BC
pros:
Very interesting place to work for and the opportunity to see it behind the scenes is a unique opportunity.
You get to work with very passionate people about the environment, conservation and animal care
Cool location
cons:
Never felt like there is a team. Everything in the IT is imposed and just do what you are told. No collaboration, no team discussions. No team building
There is ZERO career development. ZERO opportunities to learn new technologies. ZERO training.
If you dare to question any decision you are going to have a really bad time.
Not a good work environment. Negative attitude
Salary below average and you don't get bonus because the aquarium is a non profit.

pros: Fun, good team, nice to see the animals
cons: Low pay, no growth, no training or development

review_title: Has potential for all the right makings but falls short.
pros:
Offers unique and specialized opportunities to work at doing what you love.
Has good intentions to help the environment and the community.
cons: Overall, the organization does not match employee compensation to worth, does not invest in employee development and growth within nor external to the organization, and does not value nor promote healthy employee work-life balance and well-being.

job_title: Program Manager Education in Vancouver, BC
pros:
Passionate people
Working onsite at Aquarium was awesome
Opportunity for growth/development
cons:
Very competitive between departments
Employees often overworked
Unsupportive senior leaders/HR presence

review_title: Non-Profit Challenges, but Mission Based Focus
pros:
The people there really do care about the cause they work towards. It was really cool working with so many different employees who actually all cared about sustainability and ocean health. Not just in their work but in their lives - I met a lot of interesting people. 

It was also great learning about ocean issues and marine life as someone who didn't come from a marine biology background. You can learn a lot just from working there if you're interested.
cons: Normal NFP struggles - not the most glamorous workplace but probably because the money is going towards the initiatives. The managers are a bit inexperienced and need to be more thoughtful to employees - they're working there at lower than standard pay because they care about the oceans, not the bottom line, and managers should use that knowledge in their approach.

job_title: Guest Service Representative in Vancouver, BC
pros:
Nice managers who would help you to grow.
Various opportunities for cross-training in other departments.
cons: Its minimum wage on entry-level positions.

pros: Wonderful working environment and great organization
cons: nothing to complained about this place
